intro: Melochia inflata, commonly known as the inflated melochia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, inflated, fleshy fruits that resemble inflated balloons, often containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can be either simple or deeply divided. Melochia inflata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique and striking fruit structure.
